items.title: Venezuela live updates: Trump says US 'going to run the country' after Maduro capture
items.description: Trump said more information about the U.S. operation would be provided at a news conference at 11 a.m. Saturday.

items.title: Republicans largely back Trump on Venezuela action, Democrats decry it as unjustified
items.description: Democrats said he needed congressional authorization to use military force.

items.title: WATCH:  President Trump addresses nation after capture of Venezuelan President Maduro
items.description: The announcement came a few hours after explosions rocked the Venezuelan capital, Caracas.

items.title: WATCH:  Secretary Hegseth on US capture of Venezuelan President Maduro
items.description: Secretary Hegseth called the operation "sheer guts and grit, gallantry and glory of the American warrior."

items.title: WATCH:  Secretary Rubio on US capture of Venezuelan President Maduro
items.description: "He was provided multiple very, very, very generous offers, and chose instead to act like a wild man," Rubio said.
